9: The Great Wall of China was built over several centuries to protect China from invasions.
(1) The Great Wall of China was constructed over many years to defend the country from invasions.
(2) The Great Wall of China, built over centuries, served as protection against foreign invaders.
(3) The Great Wall of China is a historical monument built to defend against invaders.
(4) The Great Wall, built in the past, protects China from invaders.
10: The discovery of penicillin in 1928 revolutionized medicine by providing an effective treatment for bacterial infections.
(1) Penicillin, discovered in 1928, changed medicine by offering a cure for bacterial infections.
(2) In 1928, penicillin was discovered and quickly became the main treatment for bacterial infections.
(3) The discovery of penicillin in 1928 greatly impacted the field of medicine by curing bacterial diseases.
(4) Penicillin, found in 1928, transformed medical practices by offering a solution to bacterial infections.
11: The theory of relativity, developed by Albert Einstein in the early 20th century, fundamentally changed the way we understand time, space, and gravity.
(1) Albert Einstein’s theory of relativity, established in the 1900s, altered our comprehension of time, space, and gravity.
(2) The early 20th century saw Albert Einstein’s theory of relativity, which reshaped our understanding of time, space, and gravity.
(3) The discovery of relativity by Einstein in the early 20th century revolutionized the concepts of space, gravity, and time.
(4) Albert Einstein’s groundbreaking theory of relativity, formulated in the 1900s, revolutionized physics and our understanding of time and space.
12: Despite the growing popularity of digital media, traditional print journalism continues to play a key role in shaping public opinion and delivering in-depth analysis.
(1) While digital media is becoming more popular, traditional print journalism still plays a major role in shaping opinions and offering in-depth analysis.
(2) Despite the rise of digital media, print journalism remains essential for influencing public opinion and providing detailed analysis.
(3) Even with the growth of digital media, traditional journalism through print continues to influence public views and provide thorough analysis.
(4) Digital media has grown, but print journalism remains vital in shaping public opinion and delivering comprehensive analysis.
